title: travelplanner: I need assistance in planning a week-long vacation for 2 individuals, starting from Chattanooga and covering 3 cities in Georgia. This trip will span from March 24th to March 30th, 2022, with a budget cap at $6,800. We'll be traveling with our children who are under 10 years old, hence, accommodations must be children-friendly and should ideally be entire rooms. For this trip, we would prefer not to take any flights. (3f5cb0b59f9be595)

always_included_messages.content:
Based on the user's query, make the best travel plan for the user and save it. Do not ask follow-up questions.
Use your best judgement in finding alternatives if possible. Don't give up - ALWAYS save a plan!

chat_history.content: I need assistance in planning a week-long vacation for 2 individuals, starting from Chattanooga and covering 3 cities in Georgia. This trip will span from March 24th to March 30th, 2022, with a budget cap at $6,800. We'll be traveling with our children who are under 10 years old, hence, accommodations must be children-friendly and should ideally be entire rooms. For this trip, we would prefer not to take any flights.

# Family Road Trip to Georgia

## Day 1 (March 24th)
- Drive from Chattanooga to Atlanta, Georgia - approximately a 2-hour drive.
- Check into the Georgian Terrace Hotel. This historic hotel offers spacious suites, an outdoor pool, and a central location near many attractions, making it a great choice for families. The hotel also provides cribs and extra beds for children.
- Spend the afternoon at the Georgia Aquarium, the world's largest aquarium, featuring various exhibits and interactive activities for kids.

## Day 2 (March 25th)
- Visit the Atlanta Zoo, one of the oldest zoos in the US, boasting a diverse range of animals and kid-friendly activities like the petting zoo and playground.
- Have lunch at the Zoo's Grant Park Grille, offering a variety of kid-friendly meals.
- In the afternoon, explore the Atlanta Botanical Garden, showcasing beautiful gardens, sculptures, and a children's garden with interactive exhibits.
- End the day with dinner at The Varsity, a famous local drive-in restaurant known for its hot dogs and burgers.

## Day 3 (March 26th)
- Depart Atlanta and drive to Savannah, approximately a 4-hour drive.
- Upon arrival, check into the Homewood Suites by Hilton Savannah Historic District/Riverfront. This all-suite hotel is located in the heart of the historic district and offers comfortable accommodations with fully equipped kitchens, perfect for families.
- Take a leisurely stroll along the Savannah Riverwalk and enjoy the scenic views.

## Day 4 (March 27th)
- Start the day at the Savannah Children's Museum, where kids can engage in interactive exhibits and hands-on activities.
- Visit Forsyth Park, a beautiful green space featuring a famous fountain, playgrounds, and walking trails.
- Enjoy a horse-drawn carriage ride through the historic district, a fun way to explore the city's architecture and learn about its history.
- For dinner, try The Pirates' House, a unique restaurant in a historic building with a pirate-themed menu that kids will love.

## Day 5 (March 28th)
- Drive to Macon, Georgia, a journey of around 2 hours.
- Check into the 1842 Inn, a historic boutique hotel with a cozy atmosphere and a delicious complimentary breakfast.
- Visit the Ocmulgee Mounds National Historical Park, an ancient indigenous site with impressive earth mounds and a visitor center.

## Day 6 (March 29th)
- Explore the Tubman Museum, dedicated to African American art, history, and culture, with exhibits suitable for all ages.
- In the afternoon, visit the Museum of Arts and Sciences, featuring a planetarium, art galleries, and a mini-zoo, offering a mix of educational and fun activities for the family.
- Enjoy dinner at The Rookery, a popular local restaurant with a cozy atmosphere and a varied menu.

## Day 7 (March 30th)
- Begin your journey back to Chattanooga, stopping at the Rock City Gardens in Lookout Mountain, Georgia, along the way. This scenic site offers beautiful gardens, geological formations, and stunning views.
- Continue the drive back to Chattanooga, concluding your memorable Georgia road trip.

**Estimated Costs:**
- Accommodation (3 nights in Atlanta, 2 nights in Savannah, 1 night in Macon): $3000 (based on average nightly rates)
- Activities and meals: $2000
- Transportation (car rental and gas): $1800
- Total estimated cost: $6800

**Note:** This itinerary provides a suggested plan, but you can always extend your stay or make adjustments to suit your preferences and budget. I can adapt and refine this plan further if you'd like.

Let me know if you would like me to make any changes or provide more suggestions to personalize this Georgia adventure!

functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

functions.name: submit_day_plan
functions.desc:
Once you have collected information about the trip, call this function once for each day of the trip, starting on day 1.
If a field does not apply for a given day, use "-" to indicate this.
You MUST call this function to save the plan for each query.

current_city.description: The city for this day. If the plan is to travel between two cities, indicate it as "from A to B" (e.g. "from Ithaca to Charlotte").

transportation.description: e.g. "Flight Number: F3633413, from Ithaca to Charlotte, Departure Time: 05:38, Arrival Time: 07:46"

breakfast.description: The name of a restaurant in the city, e.g. "Nagaland's Kitchen, Charlotte"

attraction.description: Use a ";" to separate different attractions, with each attraction formatted as "Name, City". e.g. "The Charlotte Museum of History, Charlotte;"

accommodation.description: e.g. "Affordable Spacious Refurbished Room in Bushwick!, Charlotte"
